page.title: 13Collingbourne Kingston Hall
page.content: The present village hall at Collingbourne Kingston was built in the early 1930's on ground given by a local farmer, the one stipulation being no alcohol on the premises, luckily since recinded. The hall was built with money from the Carnegie Trust and the villagers themselves who have since been responsible for its upkeep. To this end there is a Collingbourne Kingston Village Hall Committee comprising of members from all the hall users. The latter vary from Mums and Toddlers and Play Group to Keep Fit, W.I., Youth Club and the young Uniformed Groups. The hall is the centre for major local celebrations, i.e.on the Queen's Jubilee, Prince and Princess of Wales Wedding, and the annual Church Fete and Guy Fawkes Bonfire. In short the hall is the village social centre.
